column15: comments"":""Conditions are such that the hostile forces favored by the time are advancing. In this case retreat is the right course

Thus we do not simple abandon the field to the opponent; we make it difficult for him to advance by showing perseverance in single acts of resistance. In this way we prepare
column18: while retreating
column19: for the counter-movement. Understanding the laws of a constructive retreat of this sort is not easy. The meaning that lies hidden in such a time is important.""}";"{""1"":{""text"":""At the tail in retreat. This is dangerous.\nOne must not wish to undertake anything.""

In such times one ought not to fall in with the practices of others; neither should one drag them censoriously into the light. In social intercourse one should not try to be all-knowing. One should let many things pass

column12: comments"":""One must not unresistingly let himself be swept along by unfavorable circumstances

column7: alchemical"":""FIRE""}";"The hexagram represents the laws obtaining within the family. The strong line at the top represents the father
column8: the lowest the son. The strong line in the fifth place represents the husband
column9: the yielding second line the wife. On the other hand
column10: the two strong lines in the fifth and the third place represent two brothers
column11: and the two weak lines correlated with them in the fourth and the second place stand for their respective wives. Thus all the connections and relationships within the family find their appropriate expression. Each individual line has the character according with its place. The fact that a strong line occupies the sixth place-where a weak line might be expected-indicates very clearly the strong leadership that must come from the head of the family. The line is to be considered here not in its quality as the sixth but in its quality as the top line. THE FAMILY shows the laws operative within the household that
column12: transferred to outside life
column13:
keep the state and the world in order. The influence that goes out from within the family is represented by the symbol of the wind created by fire.";"{""text"":""Wind comes forth from fire:

column14: comments"":""Heat creates energy: this is signified by the wind stirred up by the fire and issuing forth form it. This represents influence working from within outward. The same thing is needed in the regulation of the family. Here too the influence on others must proceed form one's own person. In order to be capable of producing such an influence
column15: one's words must have power
column16: and this they can have only if they are based on something real
column17: just as flame depends on its fuel Words have influence only when they are pertinent and clearly related to definite circumstances. General discourses and admonitions have no effect whatsoever. Furthermore
column18: the words must be supported by one's entire conduct
column19: just as the wind is made effective by am impression on others that they can adapt and conform to it. If words and conduct are not in accord and consistent
column20: they will have no effect.""}";"{""text"":""THE FAMILY. The perseverance of the woman furthers.""
column21: comments"":""The foundation of the family is the relationship between husband and wife. The tie that hold the family together lies in the loyalty and perseverance of the wife. The tie that holds the family together lies in the loyalty and perseverance of the wife. Her place is within (second line)
column22: while that of the husband is without (fifth line). It is in accord with the great laws of nature that husband and wife take their proper places. Within the family a strong authority is needed; this is represented by the parents. If the father is really a father and the son a son
column23: if the elder brother fulfills his position
column24: and the younger fulfills his
column25: if the husband is really a husband and the wife a wife
column26: then the family is in order. When the family is in order

column34: so that within a small circle a basis of moral practice is created
column35: and this is later widened to include human relationships in general.""}";"{""1"":{""text"":""Firm seclusion within the family.\nRemorse disappears.""

column17: comments"":""A lake evaporates upward and thus gradually dries up; but when two lakes are joined they do not dry up so readily
column18: for one replenishes the other. It is the same in the field of knowledge. Knowledge should be a refreshing and vitalizing force. column19: whereas there is always something ponderous and one-sided about the learning of the self-taught.""}";"{""text"":""THE JOYOUS. Success.\nPerseverance is favorable.""
column20: comments"":""The joyous mood is infectious and therefore brings success. But joy must be based on steadfastness if it is not to degenerate into uncontrolled mirth. Truth and strength must dwell in the heart
column21: while gentleness reveals itself in social intercourse. In this way one assumes the right attitude toward God and man and achieves something. Under certain conditions
column22: intimidation without gentleness may achieve something momentarily
column23: but not for all time. When
column24: on the other hand
column25: the hearts of men are won by friendliness
column26: they are led to take all hardships upon themselves willingly
column27: and if need be will not shun death itself
column28: so great is the power of joy over men.""}";"{""1"":{""text"":""Contented joyousness. Good fortune.""
column29: comments"":""A quiet
column30: wordless
column31: self-contained joy
column32: desiring nothing from without and resting content with everything
column33: remains free of all egotistic likes and dislikes. In this freedom lies good fortune
column34: because it harbors the quiet security of a heart fortified within itself.""}
column35: 2"":{""text"":""Sincere joyousness. Good fortune.\nRemorse disappears.""

column38: recognizing this

column40: so that he does not find such ways agreeable

column42: because he would not enjoy them. Thus every cause for regret is removed.""}
column43: 3"":{""text"":""Coming joyousness. Misfortune.""

column61: 6"":{""text"":""Seductive joyousness.""

column7: alchemical"":""LAKE""}";"A lake occupies a limited space. When more water comes into it

column9:
with the firmament between them as a limit. The Chinese word for limitation really denotes the joints that divide a bamboo stalk. In relation to ordinary life it means the thrift that sets fixed limits upon expenditures. In relation to the moral sphere it means the fixed limits that the superior man sets upon his actions-the limits of loyalty and disinterestedness.";"{""text"":""Water over lake: the image of LIMITATION.

Thus the superior man
Creates number and measure
column10: \nAnd examines the nature of virtue and correct conduct.""
column11: comments"":""A lake is something limited. Water is inexhaustible. A lake can contain only a definite amount of the infinite quantity of water; this is its peculiarity. In human life too the individual achieves significance through discrimination and the setting of limits. Therefore what concerns us here is the problem of clearly defining these discriminations
column12: which are
column13: so to speak
column14: the backbone of morality. Unlimited possibilities are not suited to man; if they existed
column15: his life would only dissolve in the boundless. To become strong
column16: a man's life needs the limitations ordained by duty and voluntarily accepted. The individual attains significance as a free spirit only by surrounding himself with these limitations and by determining for himself what his duty is.""}";"{""text"":""LIMITATION. Success.\nGalling limitation must not be persevered in.""
column17: comments"":""Limitations are troublesome
column18: but they are effective. If we live economically in normal times
column19: we are prepared for times of want. To be sparing saves us from humiliation. Limitations are also indispensable in the regulation of world conditions. In nature there are fixed limits for summer and winter
column20: day and night
column21: and these limits give the year its meaning. In the same way
column22: economy
column23: by setting fixed limits upon expenditures
column24: acts to preserve property and prevent injury to the people. But in limitation we must observe due measure. If a man should seek to impose galling limitations upon his own nature
column25: it would be injurious. And if he should go too far in imposing limitations on others
column26: they would rebel. Therefore it is necessary to set limits even upon limitation.""}";"{""1"":{""text"":""Not going out of the door and the courtyard\nIs without blame.""
column27: comments"":""Often a man who would like to undertake something finds himself confronted by insurmountable limitations. Then he must know where to stop. If he rightly understands this and does not go beyond the limits set for him
column28: he accumulates an energy that enables him
column29: when the proper time comes
column30: to act with great force. Discretion is of prime importance in preparing the way for momentous things. Concerning this
column31: Confucius says:\n\nWhere disorder develops
column32: words are the first steps. If the prince is not discreet
column33: he loses his servant. If the servant is not discreet he loses his life. If germinating things are not handled with discretion
